title: Spam...............but not spam
content:
Hi

I am using beta build 129.0b3 of Thunderbird, don't think the issue I'll describe is related to the beta build tho. I am using SpamAssasin to identify spam type mails. I'll include a screenshot to best illustrate my concerns...(attached)

Even tho I continually go into my spam folder, I seem to veyr much need to do this, so many of my regualr mails now end up there. I right click on each to Mark - Mark not as junk and yet over the days of use they are still being sent to that junk folder. As an exampl the ones from Meta are receipts for virtual games bought from their store. Several days back I marked those as not junk, the header of the mail rarely changes, but still they are being sent to my junk folder.

Within Outlook, on line, those mails are meant to be diverted to my Meta folder. If I was to go back to using Outlook, avoided opening it for quite some time now, I would expect to find those mails within that folder, and the Amazon ones within a Amazon folder. That is due to rules created for their placement within such folders.

I guess my question is two part.....

why do such mails seem to persist in being marked as spam..? Secondly is there a ways to ensure they end up in their intended folders..?

by right clicking on them now they ar ethe nsent to my general inbox, including the BBC type.

Is there no such thing as a safe senders list tha tcan include omains and indivudal people / companies etc..?

Many thanks

title: Cartelle locali (inviata, modelli) dopo aggiornamento vers. 115.0 e seguenti entrano in conflitto o spariscono
content:
Da qualche mese e dopo gli ultimi aggiornamenti effettuati. Ultima versione installata 128.0.1esr Ma anche con le versioni 115.0 e seguenti aggiornamenti riscontro dei seri problemi con le mie cartelle, spariscono o entrano in conflitto!! Dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento (128.0.1esr) la cosa sembra migliorata, però la cartella invata e modelli hanno sempre problemi (conflitto e spariscono!!) Inoltre quando invio nuovi messaggi non salva subito il messaggio inviato, ma si riceve il seguente (vedi immagine allegata). Poi di seguito lascia salvare il messaggio in una nuova cartella locale/inviata!!!

Sent(conflict PCxxxxx 23-07-2024 10-04-06)

Templates(conflict PCxxxxx 22-07-2024 10-00-36)

Premetto che uso il prodotto da molto tempo e con molta soddisfazione, ma ora il tutto è molto fastidioso e irritante, pur avendo il backup di tutto, ricostruire la situazione prima di questi problemi, sta diventando frequente e con molto tempo perso a capire cosa é successo.

Grazie per ev. risposte o soluzioni! Olivio

title: Autenticacion cuentas Microsoft
content:
Buenos días, he recibido el siguiente mensaje de Microsoft, y no se como debo actuar al respecto.

  • * El 16 de septiembre de 2024, las aplicaciones que están usando una tecnología de inicio de sesión menos segura ya no podrán acceder a tu correo.
  • * La protección y seguridad de la información son prioridades principales de Microsoft. Para proteger tu cuenta, Microsoft ya no admitirá el uso de aplicaciones de calendario y de correo electrónico de terceros que soliciten que inicies sesión solo con el nombre de usuario y la contraseña de la cuenta de Microsoft. Para seguir teniendo más seguridad, es necesario que uses una aplicación de calendario o de correo electrónico que admita los métodos de autenticación modernos de Microsoft. Si no haces nada, las aplicaciones de correo electrónico de terceros ya no podrán acceder a tu dirección de correo electrónico de Outlook.com, Hotmail o Live.com a partir del 16 de septiembre de 2024.'
  • * ¿Qué tienes que hacer?
  • * Si recibes este correo electrónico, actualmente estás usando una aplicación de calendario o de correo electrónico que utiliza un método de autenticación menos seguro para conectarse a tu cuenta de correo electrónico de Outlook.com. Será necesario que actualices la aplicación de calendario o de correo electrónico de terceros a una versión que admita los modos de autenticación modernos.
  • * Microsoft proporciona versiones gratuitas de Outlook para PC, Mac, iOS y dispositivos de Android que pueden descargarse fácilmente y conectarse a tu cuenta de correo electrónico. El uso de una versión actualizada de una aplicación de Outlook garantiza que te conectes de la forma más segura.
  • * ¿Cómo puedes configurar tu aplicación de correo electrónico de Gmail, Apple Mail o de otros terceros?
  • * Algunas aplicaciones que no sean de Microsoft tendrán sus propios pasos para conectarse a tu cuenta de correo electrónico de Outlook.com usando métodos de autenticación modernos. Consulta el artículo de ayuda: Métodos de autenticación modernos ahora necesarios para seguir sincronizando el correo de Outlook en aplicaciones de correo que no sean de Microsoft. Sin embargo, es posible que necesites ponerte en contacto con los creadores de esas aplicaciones para que te den instrucciones. En muchos casos, con solo eliminar la cuenta y volver a agregarla en la versión más actualizada de esa aplicación ya la configurará para usar los métodos de autenticación modernos.

Gracias por la ayuda. Un saludo

title: Thunderbird cannot find network email database after reboot
content:
I use thunderbird on Ubuntu 24.04. My emails are on a network drive for at least 20 years. Recently Thunderbird must be installed from snap or flatpak. In both cases I can still select the mail files from my network. But in both cases the path to my mail file is garbled like: 

   /run/flatpak/doc/83840e7a/imap.freedom-1.nl

But thunderbird still can find the network files after a restart. However, when rebooting the hex part of the file path (in this example 83840e7a) has a completely different number. The result is that thunderbird cannot find my mail anymore. How can I solve this issue?

title: Thunderbird has become worse on Mac OS 10.14
content:
I recently updated my Thunderbird client to v115.0b6 (on a 2012 Macbook Pro with Mac OS 10.14), and as so many apps nowadays, it has become worse instead of better: - There is a large margin on the left side of the subject column in the email list which wastes a lot of space. How can I hide it? - Performance is worse: The update of the mailing list and the spam filtering is significantly slower than before. Often takes a second for 2-3 items. Why should an update with basically the same functionality ever become slower? - The issue that external images are never shown to me even after I have allowed external contents to be shown is still not solved.

As far as I remember, going back to a stable (non-beta) and more performant version (where the last issue shouldn't exist) is complicated due to database migration. Probably someone can help me accomplish this anyway.
creator: zalutala

title: Decades Old Gmails and Thunderbird 128.0.1esr (64-bit)
content:
Dear Community,

I love my Thunderbird Mail Client and I will take it with me to my grave. Trust and believe that. However, I do have one complaint which I wish the developers would suggest a fix for, or perhaps provide an actual fix; but I tend to archive decades worth of personal emails on my Gmail account, and yet; my Thunderbird keeps downloading all of my emails; thereby eating most; if not all of my available SSD internal storage on my old HP Spectre 360 laptop.

Is there any way to set and/or designate, perhaps; only download into Thunderbird the last 1,000 emails only? And NOT delete the rest from the server?

I looked around and the available are either binary. Download only such and such, but the rest is deleted from your server, etc. Or, the inverse.

Why can't I select a target number of (or most recent) downloads WHILE still safeguarding the rest within my server without risk of permanent deletion?

If this issue could be addressed, this would be a super fix from the Gods and the Heavens.

Thank you!

title: Can send messages only once using thunderbird through vpn
content:
I use thunderbird through vpn to my work site. I am required to use two accounts, one to login to thunderbird and download messages and a separate smtp password to send messages.

After logging into thunderbird, the first attempt to send a message works fine. It prompts me for my smtp account password and sends my message.

The second and subsequent times I try to send a message, I get the popup error:

``` The message could not be sent using Outgoing server (SMTP) relay.xxxx.xxx for an unknown reason. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again. ```

The thunderbird error console reports:

``` 

   mailnews.send: Sending failed;     The message could not be sent using Outgoing server (SMTP)    relay.xxxx.xxx for an unknown reason. Please verify that    your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try    again.        exitCode=2153394004, originalMsgURI=     MessageSend.jsm:337:32        fail resource:///modules/MessageSend.jsm:337        _deliveryExitProcessing resource:///modules/MessageSend.jsm:687        sendDeliveryCallback resource:///modules/MessageSend.jsm:741        OnStopRunningUrl resource:///modules/MessageSend.jsm:1432        onerror resource:///modules/SmtpService.jsm:211        _onError resource:///modules/SmtpClient.jsm:510

``` Once I restart thunderbird, I can send a message again - exactly once.

Other mailer applications using vpn to connect to our mail system do not have this problem.

Thunderbird does not have this problem when I am connected directly to my site's internal network, not using vpn.

My thunderbird Outgoing Server configuration is:

``` Hostname smtp.xxxx.xxx Port 25 Username xxxxx@xxxx.xxx Authenticaton Method Normal password Connection Security STARTTLS ```

Those settings are consistent with my site's requirements.

I'm using thunderbird 115.12.2 on a mac running macOS Sonoma 14.5.

This problem first surfaced when I upgraded from thunderbird 102.12.0 to 15.4.1.

It really acts like things are configured okay, because it was able to send one message, but then something gets stuck after that.

Thanks for any insights.
creator: vyw1223

title: Cannot download emails getting error message "Unable to write the email to the mailbox..." after update
content: Previous thread with the same subject reported that Avast Antivirus might have found something suspicious in my mail file and locked the file. I followed the instructions to exclude my entire mail folder and maybe the parent file above it from Avast's scanning. However, it doesn't seem that whatever locking or corruption might have been caused by Avast Is going to be undone by telling Avast not to scan that folder anymore. How to unlock the file or reverse the corruption that was done already? My only backup is a full disk image. And it doesn't appear that Write access has been turned off with regard to any of my computer's users -- System, Administrator, or myself. Shouldn't any locking that Avast has done be evident from the file or folder's Properties or Advanced Properties? This is pretty much a business-killing problem. Any help would be greatly appreciated.
creator: gregg7

title: Can't consistently login to thunderbird using single sign on through vpn (blank login window)
content:
I use thunderbird with IMAP through vpn to my work site. Our site uses single-sign-on to connect to our mail server.

Sometimes my thunderbird client cannot authenticate to the server. The behavior is inconsistent. When I first start up thunderbird, one of 3 things happens:

a) Thunderbird logs me in via single-sign-on without prompting for my password.

b) Thunderbird gives me a login window, allows me to enter my password, and logs me in.

c) Thunderbird gives me a blank login window. The status bar at the bottom of the main screen says it is sending login information, but it has none to send. I never get logged in.

Under behaviors (a) and (b), the thunderbird status bar at the bottom of the main window says it is sending login information, opening INBOX, and downloading messages.

Sometimes restarting thunderbird or rebooting my laptop fixes behavior (c), and sometimes not.

When I'm connected, I can see my saved passwords via the Thunderbird Settings->Privacy & Security ->Passwords->Saved Passwords list. When I keep getting the blank login window, this list is empty.

I'm using thunderbird 115.12.2 on a mac running macOS Sonoma 14.5.

This problem was first noticed soon after I upgraded to thunderbird 15.8.0.

This behavior was duplicated by our support staff using thunderbird on Windows.

I don't have any data to show whether the problem happens when I am connected directly to my site's internal network. I'm not connected to that network frequently enough to be able to test the behavior, since it is so inconsistent.

My thunderbird server settings are:

``` Server Type: IMAP Mail Server Hostname xxxxx.xxxx.xxxx Port 993 Username xxxx@xxxx.xxx Connection security SSL/TLS Authentication method OAuth2 ```

Thanks for any help.
creator: vyw1223

title: Transferring TB data from old computer to new
content: I have installed Thunderbird on a new computer but can't transfer the data. I have followed the Mozilla instructions several times to go to help etc and cut and paste files. About 600 files are transferred but when I open the new Thunderbird there are only recent emails and no contacts. Any help?

title: Inadvertently deleted a profile using Profile Manager
content:
and I immediately began scrambling to get it back. I found this somewhere: "Don't Delete Files" is the preferred option because it saves the old profile's folder and allows you to recover the files to a new profile. So that gave me hope because that's what I had clicked (unfortunately, it was right before I saw the cancel button over on the right). That's what I get for being in a hurry I guess.

Anyhow, after 4 days of reading support forums and tons of trial and error, I'm no closer to restoring that profile than when I first started (although I've learned a lot about what does NOT work).

Btw, both my profiles have always been set up as POP3 at Gmail, although if I ever get this current problem sorted out I'll be shopping for a different POP3 provider. But that's another story.

I know how to create a new profile with Profile Manager. And I found the Profiles folders under both Thunderbird folder as well as ThunderbirdOLD folder. Have I been on the right track so far?

In the Thunderbird/Profiles folder, I don't see a folder with the deleted profile name (except the new ones (duds) I've since created ). On the other hand, I don't see the name of the profile that I did NOT delete either, but somehow it seems to be working just fine. Maybe it's the ".default" folder or ".default-release" folder? I've only ever had two profiles and I may have created the non-deleted profile first, so did that one end up being named .default? -shrug- I have no clue.

Anyhow, in the ThunderbirdOLD/Profiles folder, I also see ".default" as well as ".default-release" folders too. But in addition, I'm seeing a ".deletedprofile" named folder. So that's where I originally thought my several dozen email folders with several thousand emails and Address Book etc are hiding. But I've copied all the above mentioned folders into the several new Profiles I've created, on a trial and error basis but so far..... no luck. All I get when I open one is the new set up screen to set up a new pop3 account.... which I can do, but that's just starting from scratch without any of my saved data. I'm running out of ideas.

Where am I going wrong?
creator: RWFant

title: Messenger Chat
content: I require a copy of an entire Messenger Chat with one contact to save on my laptop. This person is beginning to delete vital information & documentation from our chats & I need to copy them while most are still there. Please help me.
creator: sstew105105

title: IMAP email on Thunderbird with Virginmedia login failing-DNS issue+App Password +VPN
content:
First off, this is an answer I wanted to share rather than a request for help. Spent significant time over the weekend helping family/friends with Virgin Media account and Thunderbird [Version 115.13.0 (64-bit)] on Win10. Virgin Media have introduced app passwords recently and all was fine until a recent update of Thunderbird. Ever since the account has refused to connect to the IMAP server. Other accounts with similar authentication methods worked but this one failed.

Issue Reproduction : System : Win10, Thunderbird 115.13.0, Norton VPN running

1. Have Thunderbird configured with the virginmedia account (by the time it worked we had removed the app password from the Thunderbird saved passwords) 2. Select the VirginMedia account INBOX in the left hand window of Thunderbird 3. Click on the download (Get) new message button (cloud with the down arrow, top left of Thunderbird) 4. Thunderbird then says it is connecting to the IMAP server (bottom of mail window), waits a while, then the message disappears and nothing happens. No new messages download, no request for the account password, no error messages, just nothing. 5. On trying to send mail there is no request for the password the system just refuses to connect to the SMTP server.

I had checked a few things on the cmd line and found that the DNS resolution of the virginmedia IMAP server was failing on lookup every time. Below is incorrect: Non-authoritative answer: Name: imap.virginmedia.com Address: 10.100.10.100

With the VPN turned off, the following was the result : Non-authoritative answer: Name: imap-virginmedia-com.edge.unified.services Address: 84.116.6.19 Aliases: imap.virginmedia.com

  • Turned the VPN back on again after running the [nslookup imap.virginmedia.com] command*

This is the solution, I found that worked for this instance. But as mentioned I spent significant time search for answer in the settings on Tbird and looking online for ideas. There was nothing that specifically reference this but a couple of ideas lead me to this.

SOLUTION 1. Start Thunderbird, go to the Tools Menu, then Settings and select it 2. In the new tab/window that opens select General on the left hand side, then scroll down to Network and Disk space 3. Click on the Settings button next to Configure how Thunderbird connects to the Internet 4. Scroll down the 'Connection Settings window that opens, to the bottom of the page 5. Tick the box next to Enable DNS over HTTPS (I left the Use Provider set to Custom and the Custom field blank) then Click the OK button. Make sure you click ok, don't just close the window. 6. Then I did a restart of Thunderbird (probably not necessary but just to make sure changes had propagated through the system). 7. Then repeated the download of new messages request with the VirginMedia account, was then prompted for the app password, which I re-entered and marked to save. New messages were then downloaded to the system. 8. Composed a new message and sent it, re-entering the password & marking save it, again (as separate entries in the password table for IMAP & SMTP). New message was sent successfully, copied to the sent folder and received correctly at the destination.

As mentioned, caveats : I don't work for Mozilla, I am a user like you, this worked for this system. I have taken the time to type this out in the hope it helps someone else, as I couldn't find this exact solution on the forums I searched. Thanks
creator: jennydeione
